title: Hacker 'IntelBroker' charged in US for global data theft breaches
summary: A British national known online as "IntelBroker" has been charged by the U.S. for stealing and selling sensitive data from dozens of victims, causing an estimated $25 million in damages. [...]

title: Hackers turn ScreenConnect into malware using Authenticode stuffing
summary: Threat actors are abusing the ConnectWise ScreenConnect installer to build signed remote access malware by modifying hidden settings within the client's  Authenticode signature. [...]

title: Hackers abuse Microsoft ClickOnce and AWS services for stealthy attacks
summary: A sophisticated malicious campaign that researchers call OneClik has been leveraging Microsoft's ClickOnce software deployment tool and custom Golang backdoors to compromise organizations within the energy, oil, and gas sectors. [...]

title: New wave of ‘fake interviews’ use 35 npm packages to spread malware
summary: A new wave of North Korea's 'Contagious Interview' campaign is targeting job seekers with malicious npm packages that infect dev's devices with infostealers and backdoors. [...]

title: Google releases Gemini CLI with free Gemini 2.5 Pro
summary: Google has released Gemini 2.5 Pro-powered Gemini CLI, which allows you to use Gemini inside your terminal, including Windows Terminal. [...]

title: Citrix warns of NetScaler vulnerability exploited in DoS attacks
summary: Citrix is warning that a vulnerability in NetScaler appliances tracked as CVE-2025-6543 is being actively exploited in the wild, causing devices to enter a denial of service condition. [...]

title: nOAuth Vulnerability Still Affects 9% of Microsoft Entra SaaS Apps Two Years After Discovery
summary:
New research has uncovered continued risk from a known security weakness in Microsoft's Entra ID, potentially enabling malicious actors to achieve account takeovers in susceptible software-as-a-service (SaaS) applications.
Identity security company Semperis, in an analysis of 104 SaaS applications,

title: WinRAR patches bug letting malware launch from extracted archives
summary: WinRAR has addressed a directory traversal vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-6218 that, under certain circumstances, allows malware to be executed after extracting a malicious archive. [...]
